definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: If it is too flat, athletes will flip .
sentences.chinese: 如果太平，運動員將翻轉。

sentences.english: Among them was Zhang Ning, a female badminton player, who impressed me deeply.
sentences.chinese: 但最打動我的是女子羽毛球運動員張寧。

sentences.english: Professional athletes were fully embraced, finally ending the tradition of amateurism at the games.
sentences.chinese: 專業運動員被完全接受，終於在比賽結束的業餘傳統。

sentences.english: The player was sidelined with a sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 這運動員因踝部扭傷而退場。

sentences.english: Athletes do this all the time.
The pro rowers from Bristol usually row in a mixed four team.
sentences.chinese: 來自親賽艇運動員布里斯托爾通常排在混合四隊。

sentences.english: Many top players from around the world earn big money playing in America’s NBA.
sentences.chinese: 很多頂尖的運動員通過在美國NBA中打球掙大錢。

sentences.english: Liu often encourages foreigners to visit Shenzhen at sports meetings.
sentences.chinese: 比賽時，劉虹都會邀請外國運動員到深圳看一看。

sentences.english: Volleying is the basic skill of the game.
sentences.chinese: 網球運動員個人的基本技術有哪些？

sentences.english: W2: The most important people in my country are definitely professional athletes.
sentences.chinese: 我們國家的風雲人物當然是職業運動員了。

sentences.english: It was the first gold won by a swimmer in a Speedo suit in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 這是身着Speedo泳衣的運動員首次在羅馬奪金。

sentences.english: The Chinese show was magnificent. Our athletes were brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 中國的閉幕式非常恢宏壯觀，我們的運動員們也優秀。

sentences.english: I could never be a mountaineer; I have no head for heights .
sentences.chinese: 我永遠也當不了登山運動員，因爲我不能登高。

sentences.english: I was 26 by then -- which is ancient for a male gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 我那時26歲，作爲一名男子體操運動員已經太老了。

sentences.english: Billy: Coach Malone, tell Robert good shoes make good players.
sentences.chinese: 可奇馬龍，告訴羅勃特好鞋造就好的運動員。

sentences.english: The athlete is checked by their physio or doctor.
sentences.chinese: 由專用理療師或醫生爲運動員做檢查。

definition: to compete/to take part in a competition
abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
to be present/to be on the scene
